==Events==
*[[19BC|19BCE]]  The death of the Roman poet [[Virgil]]; the creator of the [[Aeneid]].
* [[455]] &ndash; Emperor [[Avitus]] enters [[Ancient Rome|Rome]] with a [[Gaul|Gallic]] army and consolidates his power.
*[[1217]] &ndash; [[Livonian Crusade]]: The [[Estonians|Estonian]] leader [[Lembitu]] and [[Livonian people|Livonian]] leader [[Caupo of Turaida|Kaupo]] the Accursed are killed in [[Battle of St. Matthew's Day|Battle of Matthew's Day]].
*[[1435]] &ndash; An [[Treaty|agreement]] between [[Charles VII of France]] and [[Philip the Good]] ends the partnership between the English and [[Duchy of Burgundy|Burgundy]] in [[Hundred Years' War]].
*[[1745]] &ndash; [[Battle of Prestonpans]]: A [[House of Hanover|Hanoverian]] army under the command of [[John Cope (British Army officer)|Sir John Cope]] is defeated, in ten minutes, by the [[Jacobitism|Jacobite]] forces of [[Prince]] [[Charles Edward Stuart]]
*[[1776]] &ndash; Part of New York City is [[Great Fire of New York (1776)|burned]] shortly after being occupied by British forces.
*[[1780]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: [[Benedict Arnold]] gives the [[Kingdom of Great Britain|British]] the plans to [[West Point, New York|West Point]].
*[[1792]] &ndash; The [[National Convention]] declares France a republic and [[Proclamation of the abolition of the monarchy|abolishes the monarchy]].
*[[1843]] &ndash; [[John Williams Wilson]] takes possession of the [[Strait of Magellan]] on behalf of the newly independent Chilean government.
*[[1860]] &ndash; In the [[Second Opium War]], an [[United Kingdom|Anglo]]-French force defeats Chinese troops at the [[Battle of Palikao]].
*[[1896]] &ndash; British force under [[Horatio Kitchener]] takes [[Dongola]] in the [[Sudan]].
*[[1897]] &ndash; The "[[Yes, Virginia, there is a Santa Claus]]" editorial is published in the ''[[New York Sun (historical)|New York Sun]].''
*[[1898]] &ndash; [[Empress Dowager Cixi]] seizes power and ends the [[Hundred Days' Reform]] in China.
*[[1921]] &ndash; A [[storage silo]] in [[Ludwigshafen|Oppau]], Germany, [[Oppau explosion|explodes]], killing 500-600 people.
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[Salvador Lutteroth]] ran the first ever [[Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre|EMLL]] (now [[Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre|CMLL]]) show in Mexico, marking the birth of [[Lucha Libre]]
*[[1934]] &ndash; A large [[typhoon]] hits western [[Honshū]], Japan, killing 3,036 people.
*[[1937]] &ndash; [[J. R. R. Tolkien]]'s ''[[The Hobbit]]'' is published.
*[[1938]] &ndash; The [[1938 New England hurricane|Great Hurricane of 1938]] makes landfall on [[Long Island]] in New York. The death toll is estimated at 500-700 people.
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[Romania]]n [[Prime Minister]] [[Armand Călinescu]] is assassinated by far-right legionnaires of the fascist paramilitary organization called the [[Iron Guard]].
*[[1942]] &ndash;  On the [[Jewish]] holiday of [[Yom Kippur]], [[Nazis]] send over 1,000 [[Jews]] of [[Pidhaytsi]] (west [[Ukraine]]) to [[Belzec extermination camp]].
*  1942   &ndash; In Poland, at the end of Yom Kippur, Germans order Jews to permanently evacuate [[Konstantynów, Lublin Voivodeship|Konstantynów]] and move to the [[Ghetto]] in [[Biała Podlaska]], established to assemble Jews from seven nearby towns, including [[Janów Podlaski]], [[Rossosz, Biała Podlaska County|Rossosz]] and [[Terespol]].
*  1942   &ndash; In [[Dunaivtsi]], [[Ukraine]], Nazis murder 2,588 Jews.
*  1942   &ndash; The [[B-29 Superfortress]] makes its maiden flight.
*[[1953]] &ndash; LT [[No Kum-Sok]] a [[North Korean]] pilot defected to South Korea and is associated with [[Operation Moolah]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; Maiden flight of the [[CH-47 Chinook]] transportation helicopter.
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[Malta]] becomes independent from the United Kingdom.
*  1964   &ndash; The [[North American Aviation|North American]] [[XB-70 Valkyrie]], the world's first  [[Mach number|Mach 3]]  bomber, makes its maiden flight from [[Palmdale, California]].
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Gambia]], [[Maldives]] and [[Singapore]] are admitted as members of the [[United Nations]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; [[Bahrain]], [[Bhutan]] and [[Qatar]] join the [[United Nations]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[President of the Philippines|Philippine President]] [[Ferdinand Marcos]] signs [[Proclamation № 1081]], placing the entire country under [[Martial Law in the Philippines|martial law]] and marking the beginning of his authoritarian rule.
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[Orlando Letelier]] is assassinated in [[Washington, D.C.]] He is a member of the Chilean socialist government of [[Salvador Allende]], overthrown in 1973 by Augusto Pinochet.
*  1976   &ndash; [[Seychelles]] joins the [[United Nations]].
*[[1977]] &ndash; A nuclear non-proliferation pact is signed by 15 countries, including the [[United States]] and the [[Soviet Union]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; [[Belize]] is granted full independence from the [[United Kingdom]].
*  1981   &ndash; [[Sandra Day O'Connor]] is unanimously approved by the [[U.S. Senate]] as the first female [[Supreme Court of the United States|Supreme Court]] justice.
*[[1984]] &ndash; [[Brunei]] joins the [[United Nations]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Armenia]] is granted independence from [[Soviet Union]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[President of Russia|Russian President]] [[Boris Yeltsin]] suspends [[State Duma|parliament]] and scraps the then-functioning constitution, thus triggering the [[Russian constitutional crisis of 1993]].
*[[1999]] &ndash; [[Chi-Chi earthquake]] occurs in central [[Taiwan]], leaving about 2,400 people dead.
*[[2001]] &ndash; [[Deep Space 1]] flies within 2,200&nbsp;km of [[19P/Borrelly|Comet Borrelly]].
*  2001   &ndash; [[America: A Tribute to Heroes]] is broadcast by over 35 network and cable channels, raising over $200 million for the victims of the [[September 11 attacks]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; ''[[Galileo probe|Galileo]]'' mission is terminated by sending the probe into [[Jupiter]]'s atmosphere, where it is crushed by the pressure at the lower altitudes.
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[Hurricane Rita]] becomes the third most intense hurricane(dropped to 4th in October 19, 2005)
*[[2013]] &ndash; [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] Islamic militants [[Westgate shopping mall attack|attack]] the [[Westgate shopping mall]] in [[Nairobi]], [[Kenya]], killing at least 67 people.
